title: Throttle high-frequency events and enable compression where possible.

cards.title: Intro
cards.body: Socket.IO is a JavaScript library for real-time web applications. It enables bi-directional, event-based communication between clients (typically browsers or native apps) and servers.

cards.title: Introduction
cards.body:
• [Socket.IO Official Website](https://socket.io/) _(socket.io)_
• [Socket.IO Documentation (v4.1)](https://socket.io/docs/v4/) _(socket.io)_
• [Socket.IO GitHub Repository](https://github.com/socketio/socket.io) _(github.com)_
• [Getting Started with Socket.IO (Chat App Tutorial)](https://socket.io/get-started/chat/) _(socket.io)_
• [FreeCodeCamp Socket.IO Tutorial](https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/socket-io-tutorial/) _(freecodecamp.org)_

cards.title: Installation / Setup
cards.code: npm install socket.io socket.io-client

cards.title: Installation / Setup
cards.code:
pip install python-socketio eventlet
# or
pip install python-socketio aiohttp

cards.title: Installation / Setup
cards.code: implementation 'io.socket:socket.io-client:2.0.1'

cards.title: Installation / Setup
cards.code: pod 'Socket.IO-Client-Swift', '~> 16.0.1'

cards.title: Installation / Setup
cards.code: Install-Package SocketIoClientDotNet

cards.title: Installation / Setup
cards.code: npm install socket.io-client

cards.title: Installation / Setup
cards.code: go get github.com/googollee/go-socket.io

cards.title: Installation / Setup
cards.code: cargo add socketio-client

cards.title: JavaScript (Browser Client then Node.js Server)
cards.code:
import { io } from 'socket.io-client';
const socket = io('http://localhost:3000');

cards.title: JavaScript (Browser Client then Node.js Server)
Python (Client then Server)
cards.code:
import socketio
sio = socketio.Client()
sio.connect('http://localhost:3000')

cards.title: Python (Client then Server)
Java (Client then Server)
Java (Client then Server)
Swift (iOS Client then Server)
Swift (iOS Client then Server)
cards.body:
**Server**
_Server setups in Swift are uncommon; usually Node.js or Python is used._

cards.title: C# (.NET Client then Server)
cards.code:
var socket = IO.Socket("http://localhost:3000");
socket.Connect();

cards.title: C# (.NET Client then Server)
React Native (Client)
cards.code:
import io from 'socket.io-client';
const socket = io('http://localhost:3000');

cards.title: Go (Client then Server)
cards.code:
import "github.com/googollee/go-socket.io-client"
socket, err := gosocketio.Dial(
    gosocketio.GetUrl("localhost", 3000, false),
    transport.GetDefaultWebsocketTransport(),
)

cards.title: Go (Client then Server)
Rust (Client then Server)
Rust (Client then Server)
cards.body:
**Server**
_Rust server support is experimental; commonly use Node.js/Python servers._

cards.title: JavaScript (Client then Server)
cards.code:
socket.emit('msg', 'Hi');
socket.on('reply', (data) => console.log('Reply:', data));

cards.title: JavaScript (Client then Server)
Python (Client then Server)
Python (Client then Server)
Java (Client then Server)
cards.code:
socket.emit("msg", "Hi");
socket.on("reply", args -> System.out.println("Reply: " + args[0]));

cards.title: Java (Client then Server)
Swift (Client then Server)
cards.code:
socket.emit("msg", "Hi")
socket.on("reply") { data, _ in
  print("Reply:", data[0])
}

cards.title: Swift (Client then Server)
cards.body:
**Server**
_Server side in Swift is rare; use Node.js/Python._

cards.title: C# (Client then Server)
cards.code:
socket.Emit("msg", "Hi");
socket.On("reply", data => Console.WriteLine("Reply: " + data));

cards.title: C# (Client then Server)
Go (Client then Server)
Go (Client then Server)
Rust (Client then Server)
cards.code:
socket.emit("msg", Payload::String("Hi"));
socket.on("reply", |payload| println!("Reply: {:?}", payload));

cards.title: Client (All Languages)
Server (All Languages)
Server (All Languages)
Client (All Languages)
cards.code:
socket.on('disconnect', (reason) => console.log('Disconnected:', reason));
socket.on('connect_error', (err) => console.error('Connection error:', err));

cards.title: Client (All Languages)
Client (All Languages)
cards.code: // Go client library varies; similar patterns apply.

Server (All Languages)
Client (All Languages)
cards.code: const adminSocket = io('/admin');

cards.title: Client (All Languages)
cards.code: sio.connect('http://localhost:3000/admin', namespaces=['/admin'])

cards.title: Server (All Languages)
Server (All Languages)
Client (All Languages)
Client (All Languages)
cards.code: sio.connect('http://localhost:3000', auth={'token': 'abc'})
